snippet: One Pakistani province said Tuesday that citizens from anywhere else in the country would not be able to enter it without proof that they had been vaccinated.
abstract: Pakistan's Punjab Province bars all citizens from entering without proof that they have been vaccinated for polio; follows World Health Organization travel restrictions imposed on Pakistan to keep disease from spreading abroad; almost all of country's polio cases have occured in the northwest frontier areas.
lead_paragraph: One Pakistani province said Tuesday that citizens from anywhere else in the country would not be able to enter it without proof that they had been vaccinated.

headline.main: Pakistan: Province Bars Entry to Those Not Vaccinated for Polio
headline.print_headline: Pakistan: Province Bars Entry to Those Not Vaccinated for Polio
